name: (2E)-2-bicyclo[4.2.0]octa-1,3,5-trien-7-ylidene-1-phenylethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1311

name: (2E)-2-bicyclo[4.2.0]octa-1,3,5-trien-7-ylidene-1-phenylethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1311
Reason: The target compound has several key structural features affecting its melting point: a benzophenone backbone, a substituted styrene component, and a bicyclo[4.2.0]octa-1,3,5-triene moiety. Benzophenone itself has a melting point around 48°C. The styrene moiety, which would generally raise the melting point due to π-π interactions and increased planarity, increases the value by approximately 20°C. However, the presence of the bicyclo[4.2.0]octa-1,3,5-triene system introduces strain into the molecule, which typically decreases the melting point. This strained bicyclic system can be estimated to decrease the melting point by about 25°C. Considering the contributions of these components, the overall effect on the melting point is relatively balanced with a slight decrease due to the strained bicyclic system.
